Site Settings

Site-wide settings.

Site title 
This shows up in the title bar of browsers and in syndication feeds.
Site Logo
This shows a custom logo on your site.
MIME type of the site favicon
MIME type of the favicon (automatically set when a new favicon is uploaded)
Site Favicon
This shows a custom favicon on your site.
Expose Dublin Core metadata
Exposes the Dublin Core properties as metatags.
Expose sitemap.xml.gz
Exposes your content as a file according to the sitemaps.org standard. You can submit this to compliant search engines like Google, Yahoo and Microsoft. It allows these search engines to more intelligently crawl your site.
JavaScript integrations included in head section
For enabling third-party JavaScript integrations from external providers (e.g., Google Analytics), paste the provided code snippet here. It will be rendered as entered at the end of the head section of the page.
JavaScript integrations included after the footer
For enabling third-party JavaScript integrations from external providers (e.g. Google Analytics). Paste the provided code snippet here. It will be rendered as entered near the end of the page.
Display publication date
Show in the byline the date a content item was published.
Icon visibility 
Never
Always
For authenticated users only
Show icons in listings
Thumb visibility 
Never
Always
For authenticated users only
Show thumbnail images in listings
No Thumbs in portlets
Suppress thumbs in all portlets; this default can be overridden individually in selected portlets
No thumbs in list views
Suppress thumbs in all list views; this default can be overridden individually
No thumbs in summary views
Suppress thumbs in all summary views; this default can be overridden individually
No thumbs in table views
Suppress thumbs in all tableviews and in folder contents view; this default can be overridden individually

huge 1600x65536

larger 1000x65536

Site Setup
General

Site Settings

Site-wide settings.

Site title 
This shows up in the title bar of browsers and in syndication feeds.
Site Logo
This shows a custom logo on your site.
MIME type of the site favicon
MIME type of the favicon (automatically set when a new favicon is uploaded)
Site Favicon
This shows a custom favicon on your site.
Expose Dublin Core metadata
Exposes the Dublin Core properties as metatags.
Expose sitemap.xml.gz
Exposes your content as a file according to the sitemaps.org standard. You can submit this to compliant search engines like Google, Yahoo and Microsoft. It allows these search engines to more intelligently crawl your site.
JavaScript integrations included in head section
For enabling third-party JavaScript integrations from external providers (e.g., Google Analytics), paste the provided code snippet here. It will be rendered as entered at the end of the head section of the page.
JavaScript integrations included after the footer
For enabling third-party JavaScript integrations from external providers (e.g. Google Analytics). Paste the provided code snippet here. It will be rendered as entered near the end of the page.
Display publication date
Show in the byline the date a content item was published.
Icon visibility 
Never
Always
For authenticated users only
Show icons in listings
Thumb visibility 
Never
Always
For authenticated users only
Show thumbnail images in listings
No Thumbs in portlets
Suppress thumbs in all portlets; this default can be overridden individually in selected portlets
No thumbs in list views
Suppress thumbs in all list views; this default can be overridden individually
No thumbs in summary views
Suppress thumbs in all summary views; this default can be overridden individually
No thumbs in table views
Suppress thumbs in all tableviews and in folder contents view; this default can be overridden individually
Thumb scale for portlets 
huge 1600x65536
great 1200x65536
larger 1000x65536
large 800x65536
teaser 600x65536
preview 400x65536

thumb 128x128
tile 64x64
icon 32x32
listing 16x16
This default can be overridden individually.

listing 16x16
E.g. standard view; This default can be overridden individually.

It can be on the side (vertical mode) or on the top (horizontal mode)

This must be a URL relative to the site root. By default it is /++plone++static/plone-toolbarlogo.svg

kw.name: Enable Autologin As
kw.doc: Add and configure DomainAuthHelper PAS-plugin to login all anonymous users from localhost as a special *Remote User* with one or more given roles. Examples of use::

kw.name: Go To
kw.doc: Navigates to the given ``url``.

kw.name: Get Text
kw.msg:
Text: "Manager
Home
Test Folder
Search Site
Search
Advanced Search…
Home
Site Setup
General
Content
Users
Security
Advanced
Security Settings
Enable self-registration
Allows users to register themselves on the site. If not selected, only site managers can add new users.
Let users select their own passwords
If not selected, a URL will be generated and e-mailed. Users are instructed to follow the link to reach a page where they can change their password and complete the registration process; this also verifies that they have entered a valid email address.
Enable User Folders
If selected, home folders where users can create content will be created when they log in.
Allow anyone to view 'about' information
If not selected only logged-in users will be able to view information about who created an item and when it was modified.
Use email address as login name
Allows users to login with their email address instead of specifying a separate login name. This also updates the login name of existing users, which may take a while on large sites. The login name is saved as lower case, but to be userfriendly it does not matter which case you use to login. When duplicates are found, saving this form will fail. You can use the @@migrate-to-emaillogin page to show the duplicates.
Use UUID user ids
Use automatically generated UUIDs as user id for new users. When not turned on, the default is to use the same as the login name, or when using the email address as login name we generate a user id based on the fullname.
Login user after password reset
After successful password reset the user will be logged in automatically.
Save Cancel
The Plone® Open Source CMS/WCM is © 2000-2025 by the Plone Foundation and friends. Distributed under the GNU GPL license.
Powered by Plone
Site Map Accessibility Contact"

kw.name: Get Text
kw.msg:
Text: "Log in Register
Home
Search Site
Search
Advanced Search…
Home
Registration form
Full Name
Enter full name, for example, John Smith.
Email 
Enter an email address. This is necessary in case the password is lost. We respect your privacy and will not give the address away to any third parties or expose it anywhere.
User Name 
Enter a user name, usually something like 'jsmith'. No spaces or special characters. Usernames and passwords are case sensitive, make sure the caps lock key is not enabled. This is the name used to log in.
A URL will be generated and e-mailed to you; follow the link to reach a page where you can change your password and complete the registration process.
Test Field
Register

Allows users to login with their email address instead of specifying a separate login name. This also updates the login name of existing users, which may take a while on large sites. The login name is saved as lower case, but to be userfriendly it does not matter which case you use to login. When duplicates are found, saving this form will fail. You can use the @@migrate-to-emaillogin page to show the duplicates.
Use UUID user ids
Use automatically generated UUIDs as user id for new users. When not turned on, the default is to use the same as the login name, or when using the email address as login name we generate a user id based on the fullname.
Login user after password reset
After successful password reset the user will be logged in automatically.
Save Cancel

kw.name: Get Text
kw.msg:
Text: "Manager
Home
Test Folder
Search Site
Search
Advanced Search…
Home
Site Setup
General
Content
Users
Security
Advanced
Security Settings
Enable self-registration
Allows users to register themselves on the site. If not selected, only site managers can add new users.
Let users select their own passwords
If not selected, a URL will be generated and e-mailed. Users are instructed to follow the link to reach a page where they can change their password and complete the registration process; this also verifies that they have entered a valid email address.
Enable User Folders
If selected, home folders where users can create content will be created when they log in.
Allow anyone to view 'about' information
If not selected only logged-in users will be able to view information about who created an item and when it was modified.
Use email address as login name
Allows users to login with their email address instead of specifying a separate login name. This also updates the login name of existing users, which may take a while on large sites. The login name is saved as lower case, but to be userfriendly it does not matter which case you use to login. When duplicates are found, saving this form will fail. You can use the @@migrate-to-emaillogin page to show the duplicates.
Use UUID user ids
Use automatically generated UUIDs as user id for new users. When not turned on, the default is to use the same as the login name, or when using the email address as login name we generate a user id based on the fullname.
Login user after password reset
After successful password reset the user will be logged in automatically.
Save Cancel
The Plone® Open Source CMS/WCM is © 2000-2025 by the Plone Foundation and friends. Distributed under the GNU GPL license.
Powered by Plone
Site Map Accessibility Contact"

kw.name: Get Text
kw.msg:
Text: "Manager
Home
Test Folder
Search Site
Search
Advanced Search…
Home
 Info: Changes saved.
Site Setup
General
Content
Users
Security
Advanced
Security Settings
Enable self-registration
Allows users to register themselves on the site. If not selected, only site managers can add new users.
Let users select their own passwords
If not selected, a URL will be generated and e-mailed. Users are instructed to follow the link to reach a page where they can change their password and complete the registration process; this also verifies that they have entered a valid email address.
Enable User Folders
If selected, home folders where users can create content will be created when they log in.
Allow anyone to view 'about' information
If not selected only logged-in users will be able to view information about who created an item and when it was modified.
Use email address as login name
Allows users to login with their email address instead of specifying a separate login name. This also updates the login name of existing users, which may take a while on large sites. The login name is saved as lower case, but to be userfriendly it does not matter which case you use to login. When duplicates are found, saving this form will fail. You can use the @@migrate-to-emaillogin page to show the duplicates.
Use UUID user ids
Use automatically generated UUIDs as user id for new users. When not turned on, the default is to use the same as the login name, or when using the email address as login name we generate a user id based on the fullname.
Login user after password reset
After successful password reset the user will be logged in automatically.
Save Cancel
The Plone® Open Source CMS/WCM is © 2000-2025 by the Plone Foundation and friends. Distributed under the GNU GPL license.
Powered by Plone
Site Map Accessibility Contact"

kw.name: Get Text
kw.msg:
Text: "Contributor, Reviewer, Site Administrator
Home
Test Folder
Search Site
Search
Advanced Search…
Home
Site Setup
General
Content
Users
Security
Advanced
Security Settings
Enable self-registration
Allows users to register themselves on the site. If not selected, only site managers can add new users.
Let users select their own passwords
If not selected, a URL will be generated and e-mailed. Users are instructed to follow the link to reach a page where they can change their password and complete the registration process; this also verifies that they have entered a valid email address.
Enable User Folders
If selected, home folders where users can create content will be created when they log in.
Allow anyone to view 'about' information
If not selected only logged-in users will be able to view information about who created an item and when it was modified.
Use email address as login name
Allows users to login with their email address instead of specifying a separate login name. This also updates the login name of existing users, which may take a while on large sites. The login name is saved as lower case, but to be userfriendly it does not matter which case you use to login. When duplicates are found, saving this form will fail. You can use the @@migrate-to-emaillogin page to show the duplicates.
Use UUID user ids
Use automatically generated UUIDs as user id for new users. When not turned on, the default is to use the same as the login name, or when using the email address as login name we generate a user id based on the fullname.
Login user after password reset
After successful password reset the user will be logged in automatically.
Save Cancel
The Plone® Open Source CMS/WCM is © 2000-2025 by the Plone Foundation and friends. Distributed under the GNU GPL license.
Powered by Plone
Site Map Accessibility Contact"

Site Setup

Security
Advanced
Security Settings
Enable self-registration
Allows users to register themselves on the site. If not selected, only site managers can add new users.
Let users select their own passwords
If not selected, a URL will be generated and e-mailed. Users are instructed to follow the link to reach a page where they can change their password and complete the registration process; this also verifies that they have entered a valid email address.
Enable User Folders
If selected, home folders where users can create content will be created when they log in.
Allow anyone to view 'about' information
If not selected only logged-in users will be able to view information about who created an item and when it was modified.
Use email address as login name
Allows users to login with their email address instead of specifying a separate login name. This also updates the login name of existing users, which may take a while on large sites. The login name is saved as lower case, but to be userfriendly it does not matter which case you use to login. When duplicates are found, saving this form will fail. You can use the @@migrate-to-emaillogin page to show the duplicates.
Use UUID user ids
Use automatically generated UUIDs as user id for new users. When not turned on, the default is to use the same as the login name, or when using the email address as login name we generate a user id based on the fullname.
Login user after password reset
After successful password reset the user will be logged in automatically.
Save Cancel
The Plone® Open Source CMS/WCM is © 2000-2025 by the Plone Foundation and friends. Distributed under the GNU GPL license.
Powered by Plone
Site Map Accessibility Contact"

kw.msg:
Text: "Contributor, Reviewer, Site Administrator
Home
Test Folder
Search Site
Search

Home
Site Setup
General
Content
Users
Security
Advanced
Security Settings
Enable self-registration
Allows users to register themselves on the site. If not selected, only site managers can add new users.
Let users select their own passwords
If not selected, a URL will be generated and e-mailed. Users are instructed to follow the link to reach a page where they can change their password and complete the registration process; this also verifies that they have entered a valid email address.
Enable User Folders
If selected, home folders where users can create content will be created when they log in.
Allow anyone to view 'about' information
If not selected only logged-in users will be able to view information about who created an item and when it was modified.
Use email address as login name
Allows users to login with their email address instead of specifying a separate login name. This also updates the login name of existing users, which may take a while on large sites. The login name is saved as lower case, but to be userfriendly it does not matter which case you use to login. When duplicates are found, saving this form will fail. You can use the @@migrate-to-emaillogin page to show the duplicates.
Use UUID user ids
Use automatically generated UUIDs as user id for new users. When not turned on, the default is to use the same as the login name, or when using the email address as login name we generate a user id based on the fullname.
Login user after password reset
After successful password reset the user will be logged in automatically.
Save Cancel
The Plone® Open Source CMS/WCM is © 2000-2025 by the Plone Foundation and friends. Distributed under the GNU GPL license.
Powered by Plone

kw.name: Get Text
kw.msg:
Text: "Log in Register
Home
Search Site
Search
Advanced Search…
Home
Registration form
Full Name
Enter full name, for example, John Smith.
Email 
Enter an email address. This is necessary in case the password is lost. We respect your privacy and will not give the address away to any third parties or expose it anywhere.
User Name 
Enter a user name, usually something like 'jsmith'. No spaces or special characters. Usernames and passwords are case sensitive, make sure the caps lock key is not enabled. This is the name used to log in.
Password 
Enter your new password. Your password must contain at least 8 characters.
Confirm password 
Re-enter the password. Make sure the passwords are identical.
Register
The Plone® Open Source CMS/WCM is © 2000-2025 by the Plone Foundation and friends. Distributed under the GNU GPL license.
Powered by Plone
Site Map Accessibility Contact"

Allows users to register themselves on the site. If not selected, only site managers can add new users.
Let users select their own passwords
If not selected, a URL will be generated and e-mailed. Users are instructed to follow the link to reach a page where they can change their password and complete the registration process; this also verifies that they have entered a valid email address.
Enable User Folders
If selected, home folders where users can create content will be created when they log in.
Allow anyone to view 'about' information
If not selected only logged-in users will be able to view information about who created an item and when it was modified.
Use email address as login name
Allows users to login with their email address instead of specifying a separate login name. This also updates the login name of existing users, which may take a while on large sites. The login name is saved as lower case, but to be userfriendly it does not matter which case you use to login. When duplicates are found, saving this form will fail. You can use the @@migrate-to-emaillogin page to show the duplicates.
Use UUID user ids
Use automatically generated UUIDs as user id for new users. When not turned on, the default is to use the same as the login name, or when using the email address as login name we generate a user id based on the fullname.
Login user after password reset
After successful password reset the user will be logged in automatically.
Save Cancel
The Plone® Open Source CMS/WCM is © 2000-2025 by the Plone Foundation and friends. Distributed under the GNU GPL license.
Powered by Plone
Site Map Accessibility Contact"

kw.msg:
Text: "Log in Register
Home
Search Site
Search
Advanced Search…
Home
Registration form
Full Name
Enter full name, for example, John Smith.
Email 
Enter an email address. This is necessary in case the password is lost. We respect your privacy and will not give the address away to any third parties or expose it anywhere.
User Name 
Enter a user name, usually something like 'jsmith'. No spaces or special characters. Usernames and passwords are case sensitive, make sure the caps lock key is not enabled. This is the name used to log in.
Password 
Enter your new password. Your password must contain at least 8 characters.
Confirm password 
Re-enter the password. Make sure the passwords are identical.
Register
The Plone® Open Source CMS/WCM is © 2000-2025 by the Plone Foundation and friends. Distributed under the GNU GPL license.
Powered by Plone
Site Map Accessibility Contact"

Content Settings

Workflow, visibility and versioning settings for your content types.

Collection
Event
File
Folder
Image
Link
News Item
Page
(Default)
Current workflow: Default workflow (Simple Publication Workflow)
Simple workflow that is useful for basic web sites.
Things start out as private, and can either be submitted for review, or published directly.
The creator of a content item can edit the item even after it is published.
New workflow:
Community Workflow
Community Workflow for Folders
Intranet Workflow for Folders
Intranet/Extranet Workflow
Simple Publication Workflow
Single State Workflow
No Workflow
Info: Changing the workflow of a type will take a while, and may slow down the site significantly while the content is updated to the new setting.

Current workflow: Default workflow (Single State Workflow)

kw.msg:
Text: "Registration form
 There were errors.
Full Name
Enter full name, for example, John Smith.
Email 
Enter an email address. This is necessary in case the password is lost. We respect your privacy and will not give the address away to any third parties or expose it anywhere.
Required input is missing.
User Name 
Enter a user name, usually something like 'jsmith'. No spaces or special characters. Usernames and passwords are case sensitive, make sure the caps lock key is not enabled. This is the name used to log in.
Required input is missing.
A URL will be generated and e-mailed to you; follow the link to reach a page where you can change your password and complete the registration process.
Register"

kw.msg:
Text: "Add New User
 There were errors.
Full Name
Enter full name, for example, John Smith.
Email 
Enter an email address. This is necessary in case the password is lost. We respect your privacy and will not give the address away to any third parties or expose it anywhere.
Required input is missing.
User Name 
Enter a user name, usually something like 'jsmith'. No spaces or special characters. Usernames and passwords are case sensitive, make sure the caps lock key is not enabled. This is the name used to log in.
Required input is missing.
Password 
Enter your new password. Your password must contain at least 8 characters.
Required input is missing.
Confirm password 
Re-enter the password. Make sure the passwords are identical.
Required input is missing.
Normally we would offer to send the user an email with instructions to set a password on completion of this form. But this site does not have a valid email setup. You can fix this in the Mail settings.
yes
Add to the following groups:
Reviewers
Site Administrators
Register"

kw.msg:
Text: "Contributor, Reviewer, Site Administrator
Home
Test Folder
Search Site
Search
Advanced Search…
Home
 Info: Changes saved.
Site Setup
General
Content
Users
Security
Advanced
Editing Settings
Default editor 
TinyMCE
None
Select the default wysiwyg editor. Users will be able to choose their own or select to use the site default.
Enable External Editor feature
Determines if the external editor feature is enabled. This feature requires a special client-side application installed. The users also have to enable this in their preferences.
Enable link integrity checks
Determines if the users should get warnings when they delete or move content that is linked from inside the site.
Enable locking for through-the-web edits
Disabling locking here will only affect users editing content through the Plone web UI. Content edited via WebDAV clients will still be subject to locking.
Limit tags/keywords to the current navigation root
Limit tags aka keywords vocabulary used for Tags field and in searches to the terms used inside the subtree of the current navigation root. This can be used together with Plone's multilingual extension plone.app.multilingual to only offer keywords of the current selected language. Other addons may utilize this feature for its specific purposes.
Save Cancel
The Plone® Open Source CMS/WCM is © 2000-2025 by the Plone Foundation and friends. Distributed under the GNU GPL license.
Powered by Plone
Site Map Accessibility Contact"

kw.msg:
Text: "Contributor, Reviewer, Site Administrator
Home
Test Folder
Doc
Search Site
Search
Advanced Search…
Home
 Info: Changes saved.
Site Setup
General
Content
Users
Security
Advanced
Editing Settings
Default editor 
TinyMCE
None
Select the default wysiwyg editor. Users will be able to choose their own or select to use the site default.
Enable External Editor feature
Determines if the external editor feature is enabled. This feature requires a special client-side application installed. The users also have to enable this in their preferences.
Enable link integrity checks
Determines if the users should get warnings when they delete or move content that is linked from inside the site.
Enable locking for through-the-web edits
Disabling locking here will only affect users editing content through the Plone web UI. Content edited via WebDAV clients will still be subject to locking.
Limit tags/keywords to the current navigation root
Limit tags aka keywords vocabulary used for Tags field and in searches to the terms used inside the subtree of the current navigation root. This can be used together with Plone's multilingual extension plone.app.multilingual to only offer keywords of the current selected language. Other addons may utilize this feature for its specific purposes.
Save Cancel
The Plone® Open Source CMS/WCM is © 2000-2025 by the Plone Foundation and friends. Distributed under the GNU GPL license.
Powered by Plone
Site Map Accessibility Contact"

Expiration Date

kw.msg:
Text: "Contributor, Reviewer, Site Administrator
Home
Test Folder
My Document
Search Site
Search
Advanced Search…
Home
Site Setup
General
Content
Users
Security
Advanced
Navigation Settings

Lets you control how navigation is constructed in your site. Note that to control how the navigation tree is displayed, you should go to 'Manage portlets' at the root of the site (or wherever a navigation tree portlet has been added) and change its settings directly.

Navigation depth 
Number of folder levels to show in the navigation.
Automatically generate tabs
By default, all items created at the root level will appear as tabs. You can turn this off if you prefer manually constructing this part of the navigation.
Generate tabs for items other than folders.
By default, any content item in the root of the portal will appear as a tab. If you turn this option off, only folders will be shown. This only has an effect if 'automatically generate tabs' is enabled.
Sort tabs on 
Position in Parent
Title
Short Name (ID)
Index used to sort the tabs
Reversed sort order for tabs.
Sort tabs in descending.
Displayed content types
Collection
Event
File
Folder
Image
Link
News Item
Page
The content types that should be shown in the navigation and site map.
Filter on workflow state
The workflow states that should be shown in the navigation and the site map.
Externally visible [external]
Internal draft [internal]
Internally published [internally_published]
Pending review [pending]
Private [private]
Public draft [visible]
Published [published]
Show items normally excluded from navigation if viewing their children.
If an item has been excluded from navigation should it be shown in navigation when viewing content contained within it or within a subfolder.
Root 
Path to be used as navigation root, relative to Plone site root.Starts with '/'
Sitemap depth 
Number of folder levels to show in the site map.
Hide children of these types
Hide content inside the following types in Navigation.
Save Cancel
The Plone® Open Source CMS/WCM is © 2000-2025 by the Plone Foundation and friends. Distributed under the GNU GPL license.
Powered by Plone
Site Map Accessibility Contact"

Navigation Settings

Lets you control how navigation is constructed in your site. Note that to control how the navigation tree is displayed, you should go to 'Manage portlets' at the root of the site (or wherever a navigation tree portlet has been added) and change its settings directly.

Navigation depth 
Number of folder levels to show in the navigation.
Automatically generate tabs
By default, all items created at the root level will appear as tabs. You can turn this off if you prefer manually constructing this part of the navigation.
Generate tabs for items other than folders.

kw.name: Get Text
kw.msg:
Text: 'Contributor, Reviewer, Site Administrator
Home
Test Folder
Search Site
Search
Advanced Search…
Home
Site Setup
General
Content
Users
Security
Advanced
User and Groups Settings

User and groups settings for this site.

Many groups?
Determines if your Plone is optimized for small or large sites. In environments with a lot of groups it can be very slow or impossible to build a list all groups. This option tunes the user interface and behaviour of Plone for this case by allowing you to search for groups instead of listing all of them.
Many users?
Determines if your Plone is optimized for small or large sites. In environments with a lot of users it can be very slow or impossible to build a list all users. This option tunes the user interface and behaviour of Plone for this case by allowing you to search for users instead of listing all of them.
Save
The Plone® Open Source CMS/WCM is © 2000-2025 by the Plone Foundation and friends. Distributed under the GNU GPL license.
Powered by Plone
Site Map Accessibility Contact'

kw.name: Get Text
kw.msg:
Text: "Site Administrator
Home
Test Folder
Search Site
Search
Advanced Search…
Home
 Info: Changes saved.
Site Setup
General
Content
Users
Security
Advanced
Navigation Settings

Lets you control how navigation is constructed in your site. Note that to control how the navigation tree is displayed, you should go to 'Manage portlets' at the root of the site (or wherever a navigation tree portlet has been added) and change its settings directly.

Navigation depth 
Number of folder levels to show in the navigation.
Automatically generate tabs
By default, all items created at the root level will appear as tabs. You can turn this off if you prefer manually constructing this part of the navigation.
Generate tabs for items other than folders.
By default, any content item in the root of the portal will appear as a tab. If you turn this option off, only folders will be shown. This only has an effect if 'automatically generate tabs' is enabled.
Sort tabs on 
Position in Parent
Title
Short Name (ID)
Index used to sort the tabs
Reversed sort order for tabs.
Sort tabs in descending.
Displayed content types
Collection
Event
File
Folder
Image
Link
News Item
Page
The content types that should be shown in the navigation and site map.
Filter on workflow state
The workflow states that should be shown in the navigation and the site map.
Externally visible [external]
Internal draft [internal]
Internally published [internally_published]
Pending review [pending]
Private [private]
Public draft [visible]
Published [published]
Show items normally excluded from navigation if viewing their children.
If an item has been excluded from navigation should it be shown in navigation when viewing content contained within it or within a subfolder.
Root 
Path to be used as navigation root, relative to Plone site root.Starts with '/'
Sitemap depth 
Number of folder levels to show in the site map.
Hide children of these types
Hide content inside the following types in Navigation.
Save Cancel
The Plone® Open Source CMS/WCM is © 2000-2025 by the Plone Foundation and friends. Distributed under the GNU GPL license.
Powered by Plone
Site Map Accessibility Contact"

kw.name: Get Text
kw.msg:
Text: "Site Administrator
Home
Test Folder
Search Site
Search
Advanced Search…
Home
 Info: Changes saved.
Site Setup
General
Content
Users
Security
Advanced
Navigation Settings

Lets you control how navigation is constructed in your site. Note that to control how the navigation tree is displayed, you should go to 'Manage portlets' at the root of the site (or wherever a navigation tree portlet has been added) and change its settings directly.

Navigation depth 
Number of folder levels to show in the navigation.
Automatically generate tabs
By default, all items created at the root level will appear as tabs. You can turn this off if you prefer manually constructing this part of the navigation.
Generate tabs for items other than folders.
By default, any content item in the root of the portal will appear as a tab. If you turn this option off, only folders will be shown. This only has an effect if 'automatically generate tabs' is enabled.
Sort tabs on 
Position in Parent
Title
Short Name (ID)
Index used to sort the tabs
Reversed sort order for tabs.
Sort tabs in descending.
Displayed content types
Collection
Event
File
Folder
Image
Link
News Item
Page
The content types that should be shown in the navigation and site map.
Filter on workflow state
The workflow states that should be shown in the navigation and the site map.
Externally visible [external]
Internal draft [internal]
Internally published [internally_published]
Pending review [pending]
Private [private]
Public draft [visible]
Published [published]
Show items normally excluded from navigation if viewing their children.
If an item has been excluded from navigation should it be shown in navigation when viewing content contained within it or within a subfolder.
Root 
Path to be used as navigation root, relative to Plone site root.Starts with '/'
Sitemap depth 
Number of folder levels to show in the site map.
Hide children of these types
Hide content inside the following types in Navigation.
Save Cancel
The Plone® Open Source CMS/WCM is © 2000-2025 by the Plone Foundation and friends. Distributed under the GNU GPL license.
Powered by Plone
Site Map Accessibility Contact"

kw.msg:
Text: "Site Administrator
Home
Test Folder
Search Site
Search
Advanced Search…
Home
 Info: Changes saved.
Site Setup
General
Content
Users
Security
Advanced
Navigation Settings

Lets you control how navigation is constructed in your site. Note that to control how the navigation tree is displayed, you should go to 'Manage portlets' at the root of the site (or wherever a navigation tree portlet has been added) and change its settings directly.

Navigation depth 
Number of folder levels to show in the navigation.
Automatically generate tabs
By default, all items created at the root level will appear as tabs. You can turn this off if you prefer manually constructing this part of the navigation.
Generate tabs for items other than folders.
By default, any content item in the root of the portal will appear as a tab. If you turn this option off, only folders will be shown. This only has an effect if 'automatically generate tabs' is enabled.
Sort tabs on 
Position in Parent
Title
Short Name (ID)
Index used to sort the tabs
Reversed sort order for tabs.
Sort tabs in descending.
Displayed content types
Collection
Event
File
Folder
Image
Link
News Item
Page
The content types that should be shown in the navigation and site map.
Filter on workflow state
The workflow states that should be shown in the navigation and the site map.
Externally visible [external]
Internal draft [internal]
Internally published [internally_published]
Pending review [pending]
Private [private]
Public draft [visible]
Published [published]
Show items normally excluded from navigation if viewing their children.
If an item has been excluded from navigation should it be shown in navigation when viewing content contained within it or within a subfolder.
Root 
Path to be used as navigation root, relative to Plone site root.Starts with '/'
Sitemap depth 
Number of folder levels to show in the site map.
Hide children of these types
Hide content inside the following types in Navigation.
Save Cancel

Powered by Plone
Site Map Accessibility Contact"

kw.name: Get Text
kw.msg:
Text: "Site Administrator
Home
Test Folder
Search Site
Search
Advanced Search…
Home
 Info: Changes saved.
Site Setup
General
Content
Users
Security
Advanced
Navigation Settings

Lets you control how navigation is constructed in your site. Note that to control how the navigation tree is displayed, you should go to 'Manage portlets' at the root of the site (or wherever a navigation tree portlet has been added) and change its settings directly.

Navigation depth 
Number of folder levels to show in the navigation.
Automatically generate tabs
By default, all items created at the root level will appear as tabs. You can turn this off if you prefer manually constructing this part of the navigation.
Generate tabs for items other than folders.
By default, any content item in the root of the portal will appear as a tab. If you turn this option off, only folders will be shown. This only has an effect if 'automatically generate tabs' is enabled.
Sort tabs on 
Position in Parent
Title
Short Name (ID)
Index used to sort the tabs
Reversed sort order for tabs.
Sort tabs in descending.
Displayed content types
Collection
Event
File
Folder
Image
Link
News Item
Page
The content types that should be shown in the navigation and site map.
Filter on workflow state
The workflow states that should be shown in the navigation and the site map.
Externally visible [external]
Internal draft [internal]
Internally published [internally_published]
Pending review [pending]
Private [private]
Public draft [visible]
Published [published]
Show items normally excluded from navigation if viewing their children.
If an item has been excluded from navigation should it be shown in navigation when viewing content contained within it or within a subfolder.
Root 
Path to be used as navigation root, relative to Plone site root.Starts with '/'
Sitemap depth 
Number of folder levels to show in the site map.
Hide children of these types
Hide content inside the following types in Navigation.
Save Cancel

Powered by Plone
Site Map Accessibility Contact"

kw.name: Get Text
kw.msg:
Text: "Site Administrator
Home
Test Folder
Search Site
Search
Advanced Search…
Home
 Info: Changes saved.
Site Setup
General
Content
Users
Security
Advanced
Navigation Settings

Lets you control how navigation is constructed in your site. Note that to control how the navigation tree is displayed, you should go to 'Manage portlets' at the root of the site (or wherever a navigation tree portlet has been added) and change its settings directly.

Navigation depth 
Number of folder levels to show in the navigation.
Automatically generate tabs
By default, all items created at the root level will appear as tabs. You can turn this off if you prefer manually constructing this part of the navigation.
Generate tabs for items other than folders.
By default, any content item in the root of the portal will appear as a tab. If you turn this option off, only folders will be shown. This only has an effect if 'automatically generate tabs' is enabled.
Sort tabs on 
Position in Parent
Title
Short Name (ID)
Index used to sort the tabs
Reversed sort order for tabs.
Sort tabs in descending.
Displayed content types
Collection
Event
File
Folder
Image
Link
News Item
Page
The content types that should be shown in the navigation and site map.
Filter on workflow state
The workflow states that should be shown in the navigation and the site map.
Externally visible [external]
Internal draft [internal]
Internally published [internally_published]
Pending review [pending]
Private [private]
Public draft [visible]
Published [published]
Show items normally excluded from navigation if viewing their children.
If an item has been excluded from navigation should it be shown in navigation when viewing content contained within it or within a subfolder.
Root 
Path to be used as navigation root, relative to Plone site root.Starts with '/'
Sitemap depth 
Number of folder levels to show in the site map.
Hide children of these types
Hide content inside the following types in Navigation.
Save Cancel
The Plone® Open Source CMS/WCM is © 2000-2025 by the Plone Foundation and friends. Distributed under the GNU GPL license.
Powered by Plone
Site Map Accessibility Contact"

kw.name: Get Text
kw.msg:
Text: "Site Administrator
Home
Test Folder
Search Site
Search
Advanced Search…
Home
 Info: Changes saved.
Site Setup
General
Content
Users
Security
Advanced
Navigation Settings

Lets you control how navigation is constructed in your site. Note that to control how the navigation tree is displayed, you should go to 'Manage portlets' at the root of the site (or wherever a navigation tree portlet has been added) and change its settings directly.

Navigation depth 
Number of folder levels to show in the navigation.
Automatically generate tabs
By default, all items created at the root level will appear as tabs. You can turn this off if you prefer manually constructing this part of the navigation.
Generate tabs for items other than folders.
By default, any content item in the root of the portal will appear as a tab. If you turn this option off, only folders will be shown. This only has an effect if 'automatically generate tabs' is enabled.
Sort tabs on 
Position in Parent
Title
Short Name (ID)
Index used to sort the tabs
Reversed sort order for tabs.
Sort tabs in descending.
Displayed content types
Collection
Event
File
Folder
Image
Link
News Item
Page
The content types that should be shown in the navigation and site map.
Filter on workflow state
The workflow states that should be shown in the navigation and the site map.
Externally visible [external]
Internal draft [internal]
Internally published [internally_published]
Pending review [pending]
Private [private]
Public draft [visible]
Published [published]
Show items normally excluded from navigation if viewing their children.
If an item has been excluded from navigation should it be shown in navigation when viewing content contained within it or within a subfolder.
Root 
Path to be used as navigation root, relative to Plone site root.Starts with '/'
Sitemap depth 
Number of folder levels to show in the site map.
Hide children of these types
Hide content inside the following types in Navigation.
Save Cancel
The Plone® Open Source CMS/WCM is © 2000-2025 by the Plone Foundation and friends. Distributed under the GNU GPL license.
Powered by Plone
Site Map Accessibility Contact"

kw.name: Get Text
kw.msg:
Text: "Site Administrator
Home
Test Folder
Search Site
Search
Advanced Search…
Home
 Info: Changes saved.
Site Setup
General
Content
Users
Security
Advanced
Navigation Settings

Lets you control how navigation is constructed in your site. Note that to control how the navigation tree is displayed, you should go to 'Manage portlets' at the root of the site (or wherever a navigation tree portlet has been added) and change its settings directly.

Navigation depth 
Number of folder levels to show in the navigation.
Automatically generate tabs
By default, all items created at the root level will appear as tabs. You can turn this off if you prefer manually constructing this part of the navigation.
Generate tabs for items other than folders.
By default, any content item in the root of the portal will appear as a tab. If you turn this option off, only folders will be shown. This only has an effect if 'automatically generate tabs' is enabled.
Sort tabs on 
Position in Parent
Title
Short Name (ID)
Index used to sort the tabs
Reversed sort order for tabs.
Sort tabs in descending.
Displayed content types
Collection
Event
File
Folder
Image
Link
News Item
Page
The content types that should be shown in the navigation and site map.
Filter on workflow state
The workflow states that should be shown in the navigation and the site map.
Externally visible [external]
Internal draft [internal]
Internally published [internally_published]
Pending review [pending]
Private [private]
Public draft [visible]
Published [published]
Show items normally excluded from navigation if viewing their children.
If an item has been excluded from navigation should it be shown in navigation when viewing content contained within it or within a subfolder.
Root 
Path to be used as navigation root, relative to Plone site root.Starts with '/'
Sitemap depth 
Number of folder levels to show in the site map.
Hide children of these types
Hide content inside the following types in Navigation.
Save Cancel
The Plone® Open Source CMS/WCM is © 2000-2025 by the Plone Foundation and friends. Distributed under the GNU GPL license.
Powered by Plone
Site Map Accessibility Contact"

Text: "Site Administrator
Home
Test Folder
Search Site
Search
Advanced Search…
Home
 Info: Changes saved.
Site Setup
General
Content
Users
Security
Advanced
Navigation Settings

Lets you control how navigation is constructed in your site. Note that to control how the navigation tree is displayed, you should go to 'Manage portlets' at the root of the site (or wherever a navigation tree portlet has been added) and change its settings directly.

Navigation depth 
Number of folder levels to show in the navigation.
Automatically generate tabs
By default, all items created at the root level will appear as tabs. You can turn this off if you prefer manually constructing this part of the navigation.
Generate tabs for items other than folders.
By default, any content item in the root of the portal will appear as a tab. If you turn this option off, only folders will be shown. This only has an effect if 'automatically generate tabs' is enabled.
Sort tabs on 
Position in Parent
Title
Short Name (ID)
Index used to sort the tabs
Reversed sort order for tabs.
Sort tabs in descending.
Displayed content types
Collection
Event
File
Folder
Image
Link
News Item
Page
The content types that should be shown in the navigation and site map.
Filter on workflow state
The workflow states that should be shown in the navigation and the site map.
Externally visible [external]
Internal draft [internal]
Internally published [internally_published]
Pending review [pending]
Private [private]
Public draft [visible]
Published [published]
Show items normally excluded from navigation if viewing their children.
If an item has been excluded from navigation should it be shown in navigation when viewing content contained within it or within a subfolder.
Root 
Path to be used as navigation root, relative to Plone site root.Starts with '/'
Sitemap depth 
Number of folder levels to show in the site map.
Hide children of these types
Hide content inside the following types in Navigation.
Save Cancel

Powered by Plone
Site Map Accessibility Contact"

kw.msg:
Text: "Site Administrator
Home
Test Folder
Search Site
Search
Advanced Search…
Home
 Info: Changes saved.
Site Setup
General
Content
Users
Security
Advanced
Navigation Settings

Lets you control how navigation is constructed in your site. Note that to control how the navigation tree is displayed, you should go to 'Manage portlets' at the root of the site (or wherever a navigation tree portlet has been added) and change its settings directly.

Navigation depth 
Number of folder levels to show in the navigation.
Automatically generate tabs
By default, all items created at the root level will appear as tabs. You can turn this off if you prefer manually constructing this part of the navigation.
Generate tabs for items other than folders.
By default, any content item in the root of the portal will appear as a tab. If you turn this option off, only folders will be shown. This only has an effect if 'automatically generate tabs' is enabled.
Sort tabs on 
Position in Parent
Title
Short Name (ID)
Index used to sort the tabs
Reversed sort order for tabs.
Sort tabs in descending.
Displayed content types
Collection
Event
File
Folder
Image
Link
News Item
Page
The content types that should be shown in the navigation and site map.
Filter on workflow state
The workflow states that should be shown in the navigation and the site map.
Externally visible [external]
Internal draft [internal]
Internally published [internally_published]
Pending review [pending]
Private [private]
Public draft [visible]
Published [published]
Show items normally excluded from navigation if viewing their children.
If an item has been excluded from navigation should it be shown in navigation when viewing content contained within it or within a subfolder.
Root 
Path to be used as navigation root, relative to Plone site root.Starts with '/'
Sitemap depth 
Number of folder levels to show in the site map.
Hide children of these types
Hide content inside the following types in Navigation.
Save Cancel
The Plone® Open Source CMS/WCM is © 2000-2025 by the Plone Foundation and friends. Distributed under the GNU GPL license.
Powered by Plone
Site Map Accessibility Contact"

kw.msg:
Text: 'Manager
Home
Search Site
Search
Advanced Search…
Home
 Warning: You have not configured a mail host or a site 'From' address, various features including contact forms, email notification and password reset will not work. Go to the E-Mail Settings to fix this.
Site Setup
General
Content
Users
Security
Advanced
Discussion settings

Some discussion related settings are not located in the Discussion Control Panel. To enable comments for a specific content type, go to the Types Control Panel of this type and choose "Allow comments". To enable the moderation workflow for comments, go to the Types Control Panel, choose "Comment" and set workflow to "Comment Review Workflow".

Enable Comments
Globally enable comments
If selected, users are able to post comments on the site. However, you will still need to enable comments for specific content types, folders or content objects before users will be able to post comments.
Anonymous Comments
Enable anonymous comments
If selected, anonymous users are able to post comments without logging in. It is highly recommended to use a captcha solution to prevent spam if this setting is enabled.
Enable anonymous email field
If selected, anonymous user will have to give their email.
Enable comment moderation
If selected, comments will enter a "Pending" state in which they are invisible to the public. A user with the "Review comments" permission ("Reviewer" or "Manager") can approve comments to make them visible to the public. If you want to enable a custom comment workflow, you have to go to the types control panel.
Enable editing of comments
If selected, supports editing of comments for users with the "Edit comments" permission.
Enable deleting own comments
If selected, supports deleting of own comments for users with the "Delete own comments" permission.
Comment text transform 
Plain text
HTML
Markdown
Intelligent text
Use this setting to choose if the comment text should be transformed in any way. You can choose between "Plain text" and "Intelligent text". "Intelligent text" converts plain text into HTML where line breaks and indentation is preserved, and web and email addresses are made into clickable links.
Captcha 
Disabled
Use this setting to enable or disable Captcha validation for comments. Install plone.formwidget.captcha, plone.formwidget.recaptcha, plone.formwidget.hcaptcha, collective.akismet, or collective.z3cform.norobots if there are no options available.
Commenter Image
Show commenter image
If selected, an image of the user is shown next to the comment.
Moderator Email Notification
Enable moderator email notification
If selected, the moderator is notified if a comment needs attention. The moderator email address can be set below.
Moderator Email Address
Address to which moderator notifications will be sent.
User Email Notification
Enable user email notification
If selected, users can choose to be notified of new comments by email.
Save Cancel

kw.doc: Returns text attribute of the element found by ``selector``.
Waits for a condition, defined with Browser getter keywords to become True.

kw.name: Get Element Count
kw.doc: Returns the count of elements found with ``selector``.

kw.name: Run Keywords
Run Keyword If Test Failed
kw.doc: Runs the given keyword with the given arguments, if the test failed.

kw.name: Run Keyword If
kw.doc: Runs the given keyword with the given arguments, if ``condition`` is true.

kw.name: Close Browser
kw.doc: Closes the current browser.
Executes all the given keywords in a sequence.
